Hello there!

toqitahamid.sarker at siu dot edu

Hello, I’m Toqi Tahamid Sarker, a first-year PhD student in Computer Science at Southern Illinois University, Carbondale, USA, seeking internship opportunities. Under the guidance of Dr. Khaled Ahmed, I apply deep learning techniques to address challenges in agriculture, focusing on semantic segmentation, object detection/tracking, and computer vision.

I am actively seeking internships as a machine learning or deep learning engineer, where I can contribute to cutting-edge research and development projects that solve computer vision problems. I am eager to apply my expertise in semantic segmentation, object detection/tracking, and computer vision to real-world challenges and gain hands-on experience in the industry.

Visit my Google Scholar profile to see my publications.

Recent Publications

  • Sarker, Toqi Tahamid, Mohamed G. Embaby, Khaled R. Ahmed, and Amer AbuGhazaleh. "Gasformer: A Transformer-based Architecture for Segmenting Methane Emissions from Livestock in Optical Gas Imaging." In Proceedings of the IEEE/CVF Conference on Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition Workshops, pp. 5489-5497. 2024.
  • Sarker, Toqi Tahamid, and Juan M. Banda. 2019. “Solar Event Tracking with Deep Regression Networks: A Proof of Concept Evaluation.” In 2024 IEEE International Conference on Big Data (Big Data), 4942–49
